bioghist.p:
Edmund Port was born on February 6, 1906 in Syracuse, NY. He graduated Syracuse University College of Law with a L.L.B. (Legum Baccalaureus Latin) degree in 1929. He is listed as a student for the years 1926-1929 in the Bulletin of Syracuse University College of Law, address, 616 Euclid Ave.
Professional history consisted of a private practice in Syracuse, New York from 1929 to 1953. During the years, 1932-1934, he was hospitalized and convalescing due to tuberculosis. From 1935-1938, he served as Attorney, District Compensation Officer, W.P.A. and C.C.C., Syracuse, New York, from 1942-1943, Rent attorney, U.S. Office of Price Adjustment, Syracuse, New York, 1943-1951, Assistant U.S. Attorney, Northern District of New York and 1951-1953 he served as U.S. Attorney for the Northern District of New York. From 1953 to 1964, he had a private practice in Auburn, New York.
Judge Portâ€™s federal judicial service consisted being nominated by Lyndon B. Johnson on April 30, 1964, to the U.S. District Court, Northern District in New York. The seat had been vacated by Stephen W. Brennan. He was confirmed by the Senate on July 1, 1964, and received commission on July 2, 1964. He assumed senior status on February 7, 1976 and served until his death on March 2, 1986.

scopecontent.p: This collection contains 6 documents, including his diploma, admission to the bar, federal appointments (3) and a service award.
